t: Job 12
Job Answers His Critics
Then*p Job answered and said:
“No*pn doubt you are*i the people, And*ld wisdom will die with you!
But*ld I have understanding as well as you; I*ld am*i not inferior to you. Indeed,*ld who does not know*i such things as these?
“I*ln am one mocked by his friends, Who*ld called on God, and He answered him, The*ld just and blameless who*i is*i ridiculed.
A*ld lamp is despised in the thought of one who is at ease; It*ild is*i made ready for those whose feet slip.
The*ld tents of robbers prosper, And*ld those who provoke God are secure— In*ld what God provides by His hand.
“But*ln now ask the beasts, and they will teach you; And*ld the birds of the air, and they will tell you;
Or*ld speak to the earth, and it will teach you; And*ld the fish of the sea will explain to you.
Who*ld among all these does not know That*ld the hand of the Lord*s has done this,
In*ld whose hand is*i the life of every living thing, And*ld the breath of all mankind?
Does*ld not the ear test words And*ld the mouth taste its food?
Wisdom*ld is*i with aged men, And*ld with length of days, understanding.
“With*ln Him are*i wisdom and strength, He*ld has counsel and understanding.
If*ld He breaks a*i thing*i down, it cannot be rebuilt; If*ild He imprisons a man, there can be no release.
If*ld He withholds the waters, they dry up; If*ild He sends them out, they overwhelm the earth.
With*ld Him are*i strength and prudence. The*ld deceived and the deceiver are*i His.
He*ld leads counselors away plundered, And*ld makes fools of the judges.
He*ld loosens the bonds of kings, And*ld binds their waist with a belt.
He*ld leads princes away plundered, And*ld overthrows the mighty.
He*ld deprives the trusted ones of speech, And*ld takes away the discernment of the elders.
He*ld pours contempt on princes, And*ld disarms the mighty.
He*ld uncovers deep things out of darkness, And*ld brings the shadow of death to light.
He*ld makes nations great, and destroys them; He*ld enlarges nations, and guides them.
He*ld takes away the understanding of the chiefs of the people of the earth, And*ld makes them wander in a pathless wilderness.
They*ld grope in the dark without light, And*ld He makes them stagger like a drunken man.*i
